front.title: Domain Name Associations (DNA) in the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP)

abstract.t: This document defines a framework for improving the security of the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) in two respects. First, it introduces the concept of a prooftype for establishing a strong association between a domain name and an XML stream. Second, it provides guidelines for securely delegating a source domain to a derived domain, which is especially important in virtual hosting environments.
